meanings.definition: To arrange or organize in advance.
meanings.sent1: I will prestructure the meeting agenda before everyone arrives.
meanings.sent2: It is helpful to prestructure your thoughts before giving a presentation.
meanings.sent3: The students decided to prestructure their study group to ensure efficiency.
meanings.sent4: She likes to prestructure her day like a well-organized puzzle.
meanings.sent5: Prestructuring your tasks can save you time and reduce stress.

meanings.sent1: The prestructure of the building was carefully planned by the architect.
meanings.sent2: The prestructure of the essay provided a clear outline for the writer.
meanings.sent3: The prestructure of the game board made it challenging yet enjoyable.
meanings.sent4: The prestructure of the company's policies ensured consistency and fairness.
meanings.sent5: Understanding the prestructure of a concept can help in grasping its complexity.
